Name: Statue of Imhotep
Description: This statue depicts Imhotep seated with his hands holding a papyrus. He was usually portrayed in this attitude because he was considered the Patron of Writing and Science and was recognized in literature as one of the great "wise men" of the past. He wears a long kilt and a necklace around his neck. Imhotep is sitting on a low back seat that rests on a rectangular base.
